intro: Chlamydocarya klaineana, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Chlamydocarya klaineana is typically found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
